alert.note: Alert for Henry (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 5:51PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Henry County through 630 PM CDT... At 551 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Kewanee to Andover. Movement was south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Kewanee around 600 PM CDT. Woodhull and Alpha around 610 PM CDT. This includes Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 19 and 33. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
